synopsis.text:
Enter the world of Wakana Gojou, a high school student who finds solace in the art of crafting traditional Japanese Hina dolls, a hobby he inherited from his grandfather. Socially awkward and traumatized by a childhood incident, Wakana finds it hard to connect with his peers, especially those immersed in modern trends. His world, however, takes a dramatic turn when he crosses paths with Marin Kitagawa, the school's popular fashionista.

Marin, a trendy and outgoing girl, seems to be from a different universe compared to the introverted Wakana. Yet, she carries a secret hobby of her own - cosplay. Discovering Wakana's exceptional sewing skills, she enlists his help to bring her cosplay dreams to life. As they collaborate on creating stunning costumes, an unlikely friendship blossoms between the two, bridging their vastly different worlds.

"Sewing a Dream" is a heartwarming tale of friendship, self-discovery, and acceptance. Witness how Wakana and Marin navigate through their contrasting worlds, breaking stereotypes and finding common ground in their shared love for craftsmanship. Will Wakana's wounded heart find solace in this unexpected alliance? Join them on their journey and find out!
